properties.text: SCRUBS DON'T SKIP

You've met with a terrible fate, haven't you? In singleplayer, reading a book will pause your game, so you're probably safe. Mostly. You can also press H (by default) to open the Library. Anyways, the first thing you want to do is craft a wooden sword. Before anything else. This world is hostile and positively infested with things that would like no better than to eat you alive. This book will give you tips on how to avoid that fate if possible. Naw, you'll probably die many times before your journey is over. So go craft your sword and let's get started!

They say that every journey begins somewhere...
Now, it appears that you are about to start your own.
Getting Started
Ancient Teleportation

Basic Survival

Securing a Base

Event: Full Moon

Event: Bloodhunt

Ores and Materials

Runes and Tinkers

Basic Defence

Great. You got your sword, and hopefully a crafting table. Now that you have a weapon, you aren't completely helpless, but now you need armor. Wooden armor isn't very good, but it's better than bare skin.
Also look out for gardens. You'll need the food, as variety matters. Right click them to pick them up.
Biomes to Avoid
Savannah
Filled with hunter mobs that you can't damage until a bit later on. Check the Hunter's Handbook for more information.
Desert
Sphynxes have melee resistance, meaning they cannot be damaged by any melee weapons.
Taiga
Hiding mushrooms are high-level hunter mobs. You won't be killing them anytime soon. There's also skolles, which can teleport inside your base.
Building Your Base

Building a secure base is rather specific. Most overworld mobs spawn during day and night, and bloodhunt mobs can shoot you off a platform rather easily. So follow the following tips and you should be okay

-Build above y=64. A lot of mobs spawn underground, and ignore the next rule.

-Use unnatural blocks as flooring. This means no dirt, grass, stone, etc.

-Light it up as normal. AoA mobs may not be able to spawn, but vanilla mobs can.

-seperate sections of your base with doors. Sasquatches and warclops spawn regardless. 

-If you really want to be completely secure, replace the floor with slabs, stairs, glass, etc.
Events

In the overworld, there are two rather dangerous but potentially rewarding events. One is the Bloodhunt, which has a 20% chance to happen each night, and a Full Moon. The next page details their rewards. At the time being, you are probably too squishy to even think about hunting in these things. The mobs will annihilate you. You need at least diamond-level armor and limonite weaponry to participate. The most notable resource obtained from events is Moondust. It is needed for ender chests, ender tanks, and tablets.
There are two mobs in particular that spawn during a full moon. The first you want to kill at all costs. The other you want to avoid at all costs.
The Terrestrial spawns during the Full Moon event. It is a rare mob that spawns a portal to Lunalus on death. KILL ON SIGHT!
The Skellox has very high speed, and health. It is a formidable foe that should be avoided if possible.
Events Part 2:
Bloodhunt

The Bloodhunt is a later-game event. When one has started, you'll see in chat: "The Hunt For Blood has Begun!" First and foremost, DO NOT SLEEP DURING A BLOODHUNT! If you sleep, the bloodhunt will continue into the day. The best way to avoid it is to take shelter for the night. Each bloodhunt mob drops an Abyss Realmstone, which can be used to access the Abyss. It is suggested to wait until you have better equipment before attempting this realm.
The Anemia is a flying mob that shoots exploding projectiles. These don't damage terrain, but they do blow up items and hurt quite a bit. Anemias are immune to guns.
The Blloodmist (not to be confused with the beta tester) is a melee mob that drains vitality on hit. It's the weakest bloodhunt mob.
The Linger fires fast explosive projectiles, similar to the Anemia.
Ores and Materials
There are five new ores in the overworld that are probably quite new to you. These ores are Amethyst, Limonite, Rosite, Jade, Sapphire, and Runium.
Amethyst is useful for the creation forge and infusion altar, but not too useful for tools or anything else really. Found below level 40
Jade is incredibly useful. Its main purpose is to create various utility armor sets that can grant buffs like poison immunity, resistance, speed, and so much more. Fould below level 20.
Limonite is the most common overworld ore. It is useful for cheap but powerful tools and for crafting ammunition for various weapons. Found below level 30.
Rosite is useful mainly for repairing weapons and armor. Especially useful when used in tangent with timeless ivy. Found rarely below level 30.
Sapphire is the rarest overworld ore. It is also the most powerful ore for making weapons. It is also used for a few armor sets.
Runes and Staves
Runium is used to make runes, which are used as fuel for staves. Found below level 20.
The most basic rune is the Wind Rune. To make it, use an Unpowered Rune on a Rune Shrine.
The wind staff is a cheap and weak staff that is fueled by wind runes. You must put the runes in a rune pouch in order to use them.
Thanks to the wonderful Glassmaker, we have AoA support in extraTiC! You can make tinkers tools and weapons from any overworld metals! Check them out in NEI!
Basic Defense
The Horizon Maul is an early game sword that has high damage and slows enemies.
The Mother Void Walker spawns below level 20. She blinds you on hit and has decent amounts of health and damage, but drops armor equivalent to diamond, plus a pretty good bow.
The speed bow has an absurdly high fire speed and a decent amount of damage.
Weaken Armor gives you the resistance potion buff. Useful general-purpose armor.
The Ancient Teleporter is used to teleport to other dimensions. This structure is 15x11 blocks and a total of 8 blocks tall. This can be reused as long as you have realmstones to use.
To create an ancient teleporter, craft an Ancient Teleporter Blueprint and use it where you want the center to be.
To activate the teleporter, use a realmstone on the circular rune on the front of the structure.

WARNING! While you can create a teleporter in another dimension, it will teleport you to the corresponding overworld location instead of the portal you built. Only use this if hopelessly lost in a dimension.
Dimensions Available from the Overworld
The Abyss is a challenging world made of flesh and blood. Not reccomended for new players. Dropped by bloodhunt mobs.
Precasia is the realm of the ancient. This is also no too easy as there are a lot of immune mobs out and about. Dropped by jungle-residing mobs.
The Haven is a skylands realm full of monsters that want to send you to the Void. Prepare accordingly. Dropped by goalbys, which spawn in extreme hills.
The Mysterium is a fungal realm that exists inside the imaginations of the eeos who inhabit it. Poison armor is highly reccomended as many mobs cause poison. Dropped by bugeyes.
The deeplands is a cave dimension. It's relatively tame, and contain some useful loot. The ores are in the roof here. Dropped by many underground dwelling mobs.
Celeve is a clown based dimension. All of the mobs inflict some sort of status effect, so it is reccomended to take a staff of webs from the web reapers in the Abyss.
